author: Special Correspondent
text:
College students taking out a rally to create awareness on the ill-effects of consuming illicit liquor in Salem on Tuesday.- Photo: E. Lakshmi narayanan

A large number of school and college students participated in a rally in the city on Tuesday to create awareness on the ill-effects of consuming illicit liquor.

The event was organised by the State Prohibition and Excise Department.

The students of Government Girls Higher Secondary School, Government Arts College for Women, Sakthi Kailash College, Jayaram College, Sri Ganesh College of Arts and Science, Vaisya College, District Institute of Education and Training participated in the rally, which was flagged off by R. Sukumar, District Revenue Office at the collectorate.

The participants carrying placards and banners with slogans explaining the dangerous effects of consuming illicit liquor marched through the Tiruvalluvar statue junction, before reaching the Nehru auditorium.

Two former illicit distillers were given financial assistance of Rs. 30,000 each for purchasing and maintaining milch animals as part of rehabilitation.

The Prohibition and Excise Department conducted essay writing and oratorical competitions for school and college students. Prizes were distributed to 32 winners.
title: Students take out rally against illicit liquor
